intro: Tetranthera ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, elliptical berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional medicine practices.
